metadata.title: CVE-2024-26860 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:dm-integrity: fix a memory leak when rechecking the data Memory for the"checksums" pointer will leak if the data is rechecked after checksumfailure (because the associated kfree won't happen due to 'goto skip_io').Fix this by freeing the checksums memory before recheck, and just use the"checksum_onstack" memory for storing checksum during recheck.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
